Module 6: Multiple Choice Questions

For students

Last updated: 10/10/2025 15:56

The questions are based on or inspired by the following references:

  • Berk & DeMarzo, Corporate Finance, 5th ed. (2020)
  • Brealey & Myers, Principles of Corporate Finance, 13th ed. (2020)

Q1.

Under Standard & Poor‚Äôs scale, which rating is the first one considered speculative-grade (i.e., below investment grade)?






‚úÖ Correct: A. BB+ is the first speculative-grade rating at S&P; BBB‚Äì is the lowest investment-grade tier.

Q2.

Which of the following is most clearly a negative (restrictive) covenant typically found in bond indentures?






‚úÖ Correct: B. A prohibition or cap on additional borrowing is a classic negative covenant; items like reporting, insurance, and minimum coverage are affirmative (positive) covenants.

Q3.

Which of the following best describes a subordinated debenture?






‚úÖ Correct: C. Subordinated debentures are unsecured and have lower seniority in bankruptcy claims.

Q4.

What is the main role of a bond trustee in a corporate bond issue?






‚úÖ Correct: A. The trustee monitors compliance with the indenture and protects bondholders‚Äô interests.

Q5.

Which statement about secured and unsecured corporate debt is correct?






‚úÖ Correct: E. Secured debt is supported by collateral, providing stronger protection to lenders.

Q6.

A callable bond gives the issuer which specific right?






‚úÖ Correct: B. A callable bond allows the issuer to redeem the bond early, usually when interest rates fall.

Q7.

Which of the following bonds exposes investors to the highest reinvestment risk?






‚úÖ Correct: D. Bonds with frequent coupon payments expose investors to reinvestment risk when rates change.

Q8.

Which type of corporate bond typically offers the highest yield, all else equal?






‚úÖ Correct: C. Lower seniority and credit quality lead to higher yields as compensation for risk.

Q9.

In case of bankruptcy, which claim has the highest repayment priority?






‚úÖ Correct: A. Secured creditors are repaid first, as they hold claims on pledged collateral.

Q10.

Which statement about the yield to maturity (YTM) of a bond is correct?






‚úÖ Correct: E. YTM represents the IRR of a bond‚Äôs cash flows given its current market price and scheduled payments.

Q11.

Which of the following statements about bond ratings is correct?






‚úÖ Correct: C. Bond ratings measure credit risk and default probability, not price forecasts.

Q12.

What happens to a bond‚Äôs price when market interest rates rise?






‚úÖ Correct: B. Bond prices move inversely to interest rates.

Q13.

Which of the following is an example of a secured bond?






‚úÖ Correct: A. Mortgage bonds are secured by specific real assets.

Q14.

Which type of covenant requires the issuer to maintain a minimum level of working capital?






‚úÖ Correct: D. Affirmative covenants require the issuer to take certain actions, such as maintaining liquidity or capital levels.

Q15.

What is the main difference between private debt and public debt?






‚úÖ Correct: E. Private debt involves direct lending arrangements rather than public bond offerings.

Q16.

Which of the following bonds would be most sensitive to interest rate changes?






‚úÖ Correct: C. Long-duration zero-coupon bonds have the highest price sensitivity to interest rate changes.

Q17.

What is a sinking fund provision in a bond indenture?






‚úÖ Correct: B. A sinking fund obligates the issuer to redeem a portion of bonds each year, reducing credit risk.

Q18.

Which of the following describes Eurobonds?






‚úÖ Correct: A. Eurobonds are issued in a currency that differs from the country where they are sold.

Q19.

What does the term ‚Äúspread‚Äù usually refer to in bond markets?






‚úÖ Correct: D. The credit spread represents the extra yield investors demand over risk-free Treasuries.

Q20.

Which type of bond gives investors the right to sell the bond back to the issuer before maturity?






‚úÖ Correct: E. A putable bond allows investors to return the bond to the issuer, protecting against rising interest rates.

Q21.

Which of the following best defines a debenture?






‚úÖ Correct: B. Debentures are unsecured corporate bonds supported by the issuer‚Äôs credit reputation.

Q22.

Which bond feature limits potential price appreciation when interest rates decline?






‚úÖ Correct: A. Call provisions cap upside potential because the issuer can redeem the bond when rates fall.

Q23.

Which of the following statements about zero-coupon bonds is true?






‚úÖ Correct: E. Zero-coupon bonds trade at a discount and return face value at maturity.

Q24.

Which of the following statements about bond covenants is correct?






‚úÖ Correct: B. Covenants are protective clauses that limit borrower behavior to safeguard lenders and reduce credit risk.

Q25.

Which type of bond adjusts both principal and interest payments based on inflation?






‚úÖ Correct: A. Inflation-indexed bonds protect real returns by adjusting payments with inflation.

Q26.

Which of the following statements about secured and unsecured corporate debt is correct?






‚úÖ Correct: C. Secured debt is backed by collateral, whereas unsecured debt depends solely on the issuer‚Äôs promise to pay.

Q27.

What is the primary objective of credit rating agencies?






‚úÖ Correct: D. Credit rating agencies evaluate the probability of default, providing investors with a measure of credit risk.

Q28.

What does a downgrade in a company‚Äôs bond rating usually imply?






‚úÖ Correct: A. A downgrade indicates rising credit risk, causing prices to fall and yields to rise.

Q29.

What is a common feature of convertible bonds?






‚úÖ Correct: C. Convertible bonds include an embedded option allowing conversion into equity.

Q30.

What type of debt instrument is typically issued by governments to finance short-term needs?






‚úÖ Correct: E. Treasury bills are short-term government instruments used to cover immediate financing needs.

Q31.

Which of the following bonds typically offers the lowest yield due to minimal credit risk?






‚úÖ Correct: A. Treasury bonds carry negligible credit risk and thus the lowest yields among major bond types.

Q32.

Which of the following factors most directly influences a bond‚Äôs credit spread?






‚úÖ Correct: C. Credit spreads reflect the additional yield investors demand for taking on credit risk relative to Treasuries.

Q33.

What is the main advantage for investors in holding convertible bonds?






‚úÖ Correct: E. Convertible bonds offer investors both interest income and potential equity upside through conversion.

Q34.

Which of the following best explains why callable bonds have higher yields than non-callable bonds?






‚úÖ Correct: B. Investors receive a premium yield to offset the risk of the bond being called when rates fall.

Q35.

Which bondholder would suffer the largest loss if interest rates suddenly increased?






‚úÖ Correct: D. Long-term, low-coupon bonds have the highest duration and are most sensitive to rate increases.

Q36.

Which of the following is a characteristic of junk bonds?






‚úÖ Correct: A. Junk bonds offer high yields to compensate for elevated default risk.

Q37.

Which of the following is true about the bond indenture?






‚úÖ Correct: C. The indenture defines the legal terms and covenants governing a bond issue.

Q38.

Which of the following would most likely cause a bond‚Äôs yield spread to narrow?






‚úÖ Correct: B. A stronger economy reduces perceived credit risk, leading to tighter spreads.

Q39.

Which of the following bonds carries the greatest default risk?






‚úÖ Correct: E. Subordinated junk bonds rank lowest in repayment priority and have the highest credit risk.

Q40.

Which of the following statements about the Brazilian Tesouro Direto program is correct?






‚úÖ Correct: C. Tesouro Direto is a government program that enables individuals to buy and sell Brazilian Treasury bonds directly through an online platform.

Q41.

Which of the following statements about Tesouro IPCA+ (NTN-B Principal) is correct?






‚úÖ Correct: B. Tesouro IPCA+ provides a fixed real interest rate plus the inflation rate (IPCA), ensuring the preservation of purchasing power over time.

Q42.

What does it mean if a bond is trading at a discount?






‚úÖ Correct: A. A discount bond trades below par because its coupon rate is less than the market yield.

Q43.

Which of the following statements about debentures in Brazil is correct?






‚úÖ Correct: C. Debentures are long-term debt instruments issued by corporations to obtain financing, typically governed by an indenture defining terms, guarantees, and covenants.

Q44.

Which of the following best describes a covenant in a corporate bond agreement?






‚úÖ Correct: B. Covenants are protective clauses in bond contracts that limit issuer behavior or require specific actions to safeguard bondholder interests.

Q45.

What is the key risk faced by holders of callable bonds?






‚úÖ Correct: B. Callable bonds expose investors to reinvestment risk if the issuer redeems the bond when rates fall.

Q46.

Which of the following best describes a bond‚Äôs current yield?






‚úÖ Correct: C. Current yield measures annual income relative to market price, ignoring capital gains.

Q47.

Which of the following is an example of a positive covenant?






‚úÖ Correct: E. Positive (affirmative) covenants require actions such as maintaining insurance or submitting reports.

Q48.

Which of the following accurately describes a Treasury Inflation-Protected Security (TIPS)?






‚úÖ Correct: D. TIPS increase their principal value with inflation, ensuring real returns for investors.

Q49.

Which of the following statements about bond price volatility is true?






‚úÖ Correct: A. Low-coupon, long-maturity bonds exhibit greater price sensitivity to yield changes.

Q50.

Which statement correctly compares yield to call (YTC) and yield to maturity (YTM)?






‚úÖ Correct: B. YTC assumes the bond is redeemed on the first available call date, often used for callable issues.

Q51.

Which of the following best explains the relationship between bond prices and yields?






‚úÖ Correct: C. When yields rise, bond prices fall, and vice versa ‚Äî the fundamental inverse relationship.

Q52.

Which of the following is NOT typically a source of corporate debt financing?






‚úÖ Correct: B. Common stock is equity financing, not debt financing.

Q53.

Which type of bond allows the issuer to repay early at its discretion?






‚úÖ Correct: D. Callable bonds permit issuers to redeem early, often when interest rates decline.

Q54.

Which of the following factors increases a bond‚Äôs yield spread?






‚úÖ Correct: E. Worsening credit quality widens spreads as investors demand more yield for risk.

Q55.

What does it mean when a bond is ‚Äúinvestment grade‚Äù?






‚úÖ Correct: A. Investment-grade bonds have moderate to low credit risk (BBB‚Äì/Baa3 or above).

Q56.

Which of the following best defines a sinking fund?






‚úÖ Correct: B. Sinking funds help issuers retire debt gradually, reducing default risk.

Q57.

Which of the following bonds has the shortest duration?






‚úÖ Correct: C. Floating-rate notes have very short durations since their coupons reset frequently.

Q58.

What happens to the price of a bond if its credit rating is downgraded?






‚úÖ Correct: A. Downgrades increase credit risk, leading to falling prices and higher yields.

Q59.

Which type of bond carries both credit and exchange rate risk for U.S. investors?






‚úÖ Correct: E. Foreign bonds expose investors to both credit risk and currency fluctuations.

Q60.

Which of the following accurately describes a bond‚Äôs par value?






‚úÖ Correct: D. Par value (face value) is the amount repaid by the issuer at maturity.

Q61.

Which of the following best describes a bond‚Äôs covenant?






‚úÖ Correct: E. Covenants are clauses in the bond indenture defining what issuers must or must not do.

Q62.

What does a ‚Äúrating outlook‚Äù from an agency typically indicate?






‚úÖ Correct: C. Rating outlooks (positive, stable, negative) signal the likely direction of upcoming rating actions.

Q63.

Which of the following statements about credit spreads is TRUE?






‚úÖ Correct: A. Credit spreads expand when default risk rises or market confidence declines.

Q64.

What is the main distinction between domestic bonds and foreign bonds?






‚úÖ Correct: D. Foreign bonds are sold in a country‚Äôs market by an issuer from another nation.

Q65.

Which type of corporate bond offers investors the option to convert debt into equity?






‚úÖ Correct: B. Convertible bonds include an embedded option to exchange debt for stock.

Q66.

In bankruptcy proceedings, which party is paid first from the liquidation of assets?






‚úÖ Correct: A. Secured creditors have first claim on pledged assets during bankruptcy.

Q67.

What is the purpose of credit enhancement in bond issues?






‚úÖ Correct: E. Credit enhancement (e.g., guarantees or insurance) improves creditworthiness and reduces yield requirements.

Q68.

Which of the following correctly defines a Eurobond?






‚úÖ Correct: C. Eurobonds are issued in a foreign market and currency unrelated to the country of issuance.

Q69.

Which of the following best explains why investors monitor the yield spread between corporate and Treasury bonds?






‚úÖ Correct: A. The corporate‚ÄìTreasury yield spread tracks credit risk, liquidity, and economic sentiment.

Q70.

Which of the following bonds is typically issued by local governments to finance public projects?






‚úÖ Correct: B. Municipal bonds are issued by state or local governments to fund infrastructure and other public projects.

Q71.

What does the term ‚Äúdefault risk premium‚Äù represent in bond pricing?






‚úÖ Correct: A. The default risk premium compensates investors for the possibility of issuer default.

Q72.

Which of the following is a characteristic of subordinated debt?






‚úÖ Correct: D. Subordinated debt holders are paid only after senior creditors during liquidation.

Q73.

Which of the following best defines sovereign debt?






‚úÖ Correct: B. Sovereign debt represents government borrowing, typically via Treasury securities.

Q74.

What is the main goal of bond market liquidity?






‚úÖ Correct: E. Liquidity allows investors to trade bonds efficiently without large price deviations.

Q75.

Which of the following is TRUE about callable bonds?






‚úÖ Correct: C. Callable bonds allow issuers to refinance debt when interest rates fall.

Q76.

What is a common reason for issuing subordinated debt?






‚úÖ Correct: B. Subordinated debt compensates investors with higher yields due to lower repayment priority.

Q77.

Which statement about yield to maturity (YTM) is correct?






‚úÖ Correct: A. YTM is the internal rate of return on a bond‚Äôs total future payments.

Q78.

What is a typical feature of investment-grade bonds?






‚úÖ Correct: D. Investment-grade bonds are considered safe, offering lower yields than speculative bonds.

Q79.

Which type of bond is backed by a specific pool of assets such as mortgages or loans?






‚úÖ Correct: C. ABS instruments are secured by underlying financial assets that generate cash flows.

Q80.

Which of the following best describes the purpose of credit ratings?






‚úÖ Correct: E. Credit ratings evaluate the likelihood that a borrower will meet its debt obligations.

Q81.

Which of the following statements about bond ratings is TRUE?






‚úÖ Correct: C. When a bond is downgraded, its credit risk rises, causing higher yields and lower prices.

Q82.

What does the term ‚Äújunk bond‚Äù refer to?






‚úÖ Correct: A. Junk bonds are speculative-grade securities with higher yields and higher risk of default.

Q83.

Which of the following describes a Yankee bond?






‚úÖ Correct: E. Yankee bonds are foreign issues sold in the U.S. market and denominated in U.S. dollars.

Q84.

What is the typical relationship between bond prices and interest rates?






‚úÖ Correct: B. Bond prices fall when interest rates rise and rise when rates fall.

Q85.

Which of the following best defines a callable bond?






‚úÖ Correct: C. Callable bonds give the issuer the right to redeem early, typically when rates fall.

Q86.

What is a putable bond?






‚úÖ Correct: A. Putable bonds protect investors by allowing them to sell the bond back before maturity.

Q87.

Which of the following is an advantage of issuing bonds rather than equity?






‚úÖ Correct: D. Debt financing provides tax shields through deductible interest expenses.

Q88.

What is the key characteristic of zero-coupon bonds?






‚úÖ Correct: B. Zero-coupon bonds have no periodic payments and mature at face value.

Q89.

Which of the following best defines a convertible bond?






‚úÖ Correct: E. Convertible bonds combine features of debt and equity, allowing conversion into shares.

Q90.

Which of the following statements about bond indentures is TRUE?






‚úÖ Correct: A. The indenture is a legal contract detailing obligations, covenants, and repayment terms.

Q91.

Which of the following describes the main purpose of a sinking fund provision?






‚úÖ Correct: B. Sinking funds reduce default risk by requiring gradual debt repayment.

Q92.

Which statement about interest rate risk is TRUE?






‚úÖ Correct: D. Longer-duration bonds experience larger price changes when interest rates shift.

Q93.

Which of the following statements best defines duration?






‚úÖ Correct: A. Duration measures the average time-weighted value of a bond‚Äôs cash flows.

Q94.

Which of the following best defines a secured bond?






‚úÖ Correct: E. Secured bonds are collateralized by specific assets such as property or equipment.

Q95.

What distinguishes a corporate bond from a government bond?






‚úÖ Correct: C. Corporate bonds finance private sector operations, unlike government debt for fiscal policy.

Q96.

Which of the following correctly defines the yield curve?






‚úÖ Correct: B. The yield curve shows yields across different maturities for similar-risk securities.

Q97.

Which factor most influences the slope of the yield curve?






‚úÖ Correct: D. The yield curve‚Äôs shape reflects market expectations for future rates and inflation.

Q98.

Which of the following statements about Treasury bills (T-bills) is TRUE?






‚úÖ Correct: A. T-bills are short-term, zero-coupon government securities sold below face value.

Q99.

Which of the following statements about convertible bonds is correct?






‚úÖ Correct: E. Convertible bonds let investors convert bonds into shares if the stock performs well.

Q100.

What is the key distinction between public and private debt?






‚úÖ Correct: C. Public debt is broadly traded, whereas private debt involves direct lender‚Äìborrower agreements.

Group 1 of 20
